comments.body: The Windows version of this file `update_dart_sdk.ps1` should probably also include this warning. Some users in China may be on Windows.

Looks like that script doesn't know how to determine if the download failed. I'll file a bug about adding that; I would rather my "change some strings" PR didn't turn into a "learn powershell" PR... :-)
Somebody once told me "embrace the yak shave!" ðŸ˜›
I'm knee-deep in yak hair as it is. :-P

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +54,58 @@  curl --continue-at - --location --output "$DART_SDK_ZIP" "$DART_SDK_URL" 2>&1 || {
    echo
    echo "Failed to retrieve the Dart SDK from: $DART_SDK_URL"
    echo "If you're located in China, please see this page:"
    echo "  https://flutter.io/community/china"

comments.body: Any reason not to keep the default exponential backoff behavior?

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +82,86 @@  DART_SDK_ZIP="$FLUTTER_ROOT/bin/cache/$DART_ZIP_NAME"

  curl --retry-connrefused --retry 3 --retry-delay 5 --continue-at - --location --output "$DART_SDK_ZIP" "$DART_SDK_URL" 2>&1 || {
    echo
    echo "Failed to retrieve the Dart SDK from: $DART_SDK_URL"
